page.title: 17A DAY AT ST. PETER'S SCHOOL
page.content: A typical day for a sixth form (13 years old) boarder at St.Peter's Preparatory School. At 7.30a.m the boarders are woken and at 8.00a.m they have breakfast. Then at 8.25a.m they prepare for school . At 8.40a.m school commences with registration and daypupils arrive Then at 8.45a.m we have assembly and at 9.10a.m lessons commence . These consist of 3 lessons of 35 minutes , and at 10.55a.m we have a 20 minute break. At 11.15a.m lessons restart and we have another two lessons of 35 and 40 minutes. At 12.30p.m lunch starts and the lunch break finishes at 1.05p.m. Then we have a period called Rest and Read when you can read books or play squash or tennis etc.At 1.35p.m we have 3 more lessons of 35 minutes each until 3.20p.m.Then we have games until 4.25 (cont. on p.18)
